publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7157 Lewis Macdonald: The Future of Scotland’s Supported Employment Workplaces—That the Parliament notes the Scottish Government’s policy that every public body should aim to have at least one contract with a supported factory or business, as set out in its Social Issues in Public Procurement guidance document in October 2007 and reiterated as part of the Scottish Sustainable Procurement Action Plan in October 2009; welcomes this approach as the most effective means of public policy support for the sector; regrets the lack of evidence that this policy has been effectively pursued over the last three years, and calls on the Scottish Government to set a timetable for every public body in Scotland for which it is responsible to have at least one contract with a supported factory or business. Supported by: Johann Lamont*
